availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The Commonwealth of Kentucky To the Sheriff of Jefferson County

We demand you to take Brent Fishback if to be found within your bailiwick and him safely keep so that you have his body before the Judge of our Garrard Circuit Court at the court house in the town of Lancaster on the 4" Monday in April, next so that he satisfy and pay to the commonwealth aforesaid the Sum of Fifty dollars for fine against him for carrying a deadly weapon concealed also the sum of eight dollars 25 cents adjudged to the said Commonwealth for her costs in that behalf expended and this you shall no wise omit under the penalty of the law and have then there this writ with due return how you have executed it. Witness W D Hopper Clerk Garrard Circuit Court this 15" day of march 1865

This is a True Coppy of the Garrard Circuit Court now in my hands Thos Shanks D S for W A Ronald S. J. C
March 17 65
